DataElement.preferredName: Extrahepatic Metastasis Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to history of having cancer that has spread from the organ going to locations outside the liver.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to history of having cancer that has spread from the organ going to locations outside the liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (extra-heh-PAT-ik) Located or occurring outside the liver.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: Located or occurring outside the liver.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
